page.title: 04LANDRAKE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: St.Michael's Church was built in 1269 and still retains some original stonework. Normal church services are held on Sundays and special occasions,while {Sir Robert Geffery's School}uses it for its own special religious occasions,thus retaining the link between the church and Sir Robert when he endowed the school. Congregations average about 45 persons weekly,although many more attend the Festivals of Easter,Christmas & Harvest. The village has expanded considerably over the last ten years and this has shown up in the life of the church with the rise in number of marriages and baptisms.The electoral roll of the church contains 160 names. There is no incumbent of the living at present.the vicar retired in 1984.
